name: Queuey
tagline: Extend Activator by rPetrich with action queues, timers, conditionals, and more!
body:
### Welcome to Queuey.
Queuey is an application for jailbroken iOS devices that makes your life awesome by extending Ryan Petrich's famous [Activator](https://github.com/rpetrich/libactivator/) tweak.

### What is Activator?
Activator, as self described, allows centralized gestures and button management for iOS. Since its debut in 2010, it has garnered a massive following from users in the jailbreak community, due to its power and ease of use.  However, Activator does have its limitations, namely: there is only very basic 'multiple actions' support, there are no timers, and conditional statements are but a dream.

**Or are they?**

### What is Queuey?
Queuey extends Activator in all three ways above. Using Queuey, one can set up 'queues', or workflows, that utilize Activator's power and extensibility.  Delays can be freely configured and used to great effect.  In addition, conditional statements (if statements) can be created in a fashionable GUI.

### Queue Ideas
Once Queuey is installed, the possibilities are endless! Since Queuey can interact with any Activator plugins installed, interesting possibilities open up.

One great example of an extension that Queuey can utilize is HueHueHue, by Ethan Gill (@ethansinjin), one of this project's authors. Using HueHueHue, Queuey can toggle the state of Philips Hue lighting systems over local Wi-Fi. This, accompanied by delays and conditionals, can lead to powerful actions. One could tap the home button three times to turn lights off, wait 5 seconds, turn on Airplane Mode, and start playing music!

### About the Authors
This project was completed in under 36 hours by:
* Jaden Geller (@JadenGeller)
* Ethan Gill (@ethansinjin)

Jaden Geller is an awesome person. He currently attends Caltech as a freshman, and is 18 years old.  He attended WWDC 2013 on a student scholarship, and has released several App Store applications. This is his first foray into jailbroken development.

Ethan Gill is a dual-credit earning high school senior and college sophomore who attends The Carol Martin Gatton Academy of Mathematics and Science in Kentucky.  He is 17 years old.  Since attending WWDC on a student scholarship in 2013 (where he met Jaden), he has continuously developed in Objective-C. He has released two Cydia tweaks, HueHueHue and ScreenshotShareSheet.

### The Future of Queuey
Queuey will be released in Cydia for an introductory price of $2.99 for two weeks. After that, it will be $3.99.  Keep your eyes peeled for the future!

### Support or Contact
For support, bug reports, or feature requests, please contact ethan.gill@me.com.

If you would like to help localize Queuey, please contact ethan.gill@me.com

If you're at HackTECH, we're the two sleep-deprived kids in between the Firebase and Pinterest tables.  Feel free to stop by!
